Definition at line 35 of file ntrxutil.c.

Function Documentation

bool_t NTRXAllCalibration ( void   ) 

calibrates the local ocsillator.

This function callibrates the local oscillator for both the transmitter and the receiver part. This function should be called regularly to maintain a stable and in spec transmission.

Definition at line 325 of file ntrxutil.c.

bool_t NTRXAllFakeCalibration ( void   ) 

copy values from last calibration into chip.

Definition at line 308 of file ntrxutil.c.

bool_t NTRXCheckVerRev ( void   ) 

read out version an revision of the transceiver chip.

Returns:
TRUE if equal, False if not equal or SPI access failed.
This function compares the version and revision register with the expected Version and Revision number from the software.

void NTRXFctCal ( void   ) 

sets the capacitors to tune the frequency.

This function executes the recommended procedure to tune the frequency by en- and disableing capacitors.

uint32_t NTRXGetRtc ( bool_t  force  ) 

read out the real time clock of the transceiver.

Parameters:
force == TRUE lets the function read the RTC anyway
Returns:
the time in 1/32768 seconds (ca. 30 us)
This function reads out the real time clock of the transceiver

< stores the last RTC value

< stores the hwclock value when RTC was read

Definition at line 654 of file ntrxutil.c.

bool_t NTRXGetRxCrc2Mode ( void   ) 

returns the setting vor the CRC-2 mode of the transceiver chip.

Returns:
On (TRUE) or Off (FALSE).
This function returns the CRC-2 mode settings in the transceiver chip. The value is taken from the shadow ram.

Definition at line 410 of file ntrxutil.c.

uint8_t NTRXGetTxArqMax ( void   ) 

read out number of retransmission attempts.

Returns:
tx arq maximum value in the range of (0x0...0xE).
This function returns the number of packet retransmissions used by the nanoLOC chip. The value is taken from the shadow ram.

Definition at line 396 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXInitShadowRegister ( void   ) 

initialize shadow registers.

This function initializes the shadow register array to the initial values in the transceiver when it is powered up or reset.

Definition at line 120 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXPowerdownMode ( uint8_t  mode,
uint32_t  ms 
)

read out the real time clock of the transceiver.

Parameters:
mode 0 is full and 1 is for pad mode
seconds wake up time from now
This function starts the alarm clock if the parameter seconds is greater than 0 and brings the transceiver into the requested powerdown mode. There are two powerdown modes supported: powerdown mode full and powerdown mode pad. The second mode can be used to supervise the dig-IO pins of the nanoLOC chip.

calibrates the local ocsillator.

void NTRXSetIndexReg ( uint8_t  page  ) 

set the index register.

Parameters:
page address index
This function sets the index registers for the transceiver chip. The chip address space is deviced into 4 sections a 1kbyte.

This function sets the index registers for the transceiver chip The chip address space is deviced into 4 sections a 1kbyte.

Definition at line 207 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXSetSyncWord ( uint8_t *  value  ) 

sets the sync word in the transceiver.

Parameters:
value a pointer to the 8 byte syncword.
This function writes the syncword in the syncword register. The syncword is used for add a transceivers to a logical group. Only messages with the right syncword are detected (received) and processed.

Definition at line 482 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXSetTestCarrierMode ( bool_t  value  ) 

Carriermode for chip measurement.

This function enables or disables the unmodulated carrier signal test mode by sending a continuous carrier. This requires to swich off the receiver. Note: This function should be periodically interrupted and the transmitter recalibrated. Otherwise the frequency might be out of range.

Definition at line 862 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXSetTestChirpMode ( bool_t  value  ) 

Testmode for chip measurement.

This function enables or disables the chip test mode. In this mode a continuous chirp is transmitted. This requires to swich off the receiver. Note: This function should be interrupted periodically and the transmitter recalibrated. Otherwise the frequency might be out of range.

Definition at line 808 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXSetupTrxMode ( uint8_t  fdma,
uint8_t  sd,
uint8_t  sr 
)

sets transmission mode in the transceiver.

Parameters:
fdma this parameter determines the the mode (fdma or 80 MHz)
sd this parameter determines the symbol duration between 500ns and 8us)
sr this parameter determines the symbol rate between 125kbit and 2Mbit)
Based on the three parameters the transceiver is initialized. The iq parameter are set and the nanoLOC chip is calibrated.

Definition at line 499 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXStartBbTimer ( int16_t  startvalue  ) 

starts the baseband timer.

Parameters:
startvalue countdown value in us
Starts a countdown from startvalue to zero ( in us )

Definition at line 779 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXStopBbTimer ( void   ) 

stops the baseband timer.

Stops the baseband timer. The baseband timer is recommended for very short timer intervals < 1 ms

Definition at line 793 of file ntrxutil.c.

void NTRXTxLoCalibration ( void   ) 

calibrates the local ocsillator.

This function callibrates the local oscillator of the transmitter part. It is not called directly but from within the NTRXAllCalibration function.
